title: Valid User Login with Role-Based Access
description: Verify that a user can log in with valid credentials and is granted access according to assigned role permissions.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter valid username/email and password.
Click the login button.
Verify login success and redirection to the dashboard.
Verify user interface elements and module access correspond to the role permissions.

title: Invalid Login Attempts Handling
description: Verify the system properly handles invalid login attempts and prevents access.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter incorrect username/email and password combinations.
Click the login button.
Verify that login is denied and appropriate error message is displayed.
Attempt to access a protected URL without authentication.
Verify access is blocked and user is redirected to login.

title: Dashboard Statistics Accuracy
description: Verify that dashboard statistics for posts, users, views, and recent activity are accurate and reflect current database content.

steps.description: Log in as admin user.
Navigate to admin dashboard.
Verify that posts count matches the number of posts in the database.
Verify that user count matches registered users.
Verify views and recent activity data are displayed and updated.
Verify chart visualizations render correctly with appropriate data.

title: Create, Read, Update, Delete (CRUD) Post with SEO and Media
description: Verify that posts can be created, edited, viewed, and deleted correctly, including rich text content, SEO metadata, and media attachments.

steps.description: Log in as content creator or admin.
Navigate to posts management.
Create a new post with title, rich text content via CKEditor 5, SEO fields, and upload media.
Verify the post is saved and visible in the posts list.
View the post details.
Verify that SEO metadata is present in page source.
Edit the post content and update SEO settings.
Verify the updates are saved and reflected correctly.
Delete the post.
Verify the post is removed from the system.

title: Category Management with Unique Slugs
description: Verify creation, editing, and deletion of post categories ensuring unique slug enforcement and proper inline tag editing.

steps.description: Navigate to categories management.
Create a new category with a unique name and slug.
Verify category is created and displayed.
Attempt to create another category with duplicate slug.
Verify system prevents creation and shows appropriate error.
Edit an existing category's slug to another existing slug.
Verify editing is blocked and error is shown.
Use inline editing to update tags.
Verify tags update correctly and persist.

title: Media Upload and Thumbnail Generation
description: Verify uploading various media file types, validations, automatic thumbnail creation, and media management features.

steps.description: Navigate to media library.
Upload valid image files (jpg, png, gif).
Verify uploads succeed and thumbnails are generated.
Upload unsupported file type (e.g., exe, large-size > limit).
Verify upload is rejected with proper error messages.
Delete a media file.
Verify media is removed from library and references.

title: Guru & Staff Data CRUD with Role Filtering
description: Verify creation, editing, listing, filtering by roles, and deletion of school personnel including photo upload.

steps.description: Navigate to Guru & Staff module.
Create a new personnel record with photo and role.
Verify record is saved and displayed with photo.
Update personnel information.
Verify changes persist correctly.
Use role filter to list personnel by role.
Verify filtered results correspond to selected role.
Delete personnel record.
Verify record is removed from the system.

title: Static Pages with SEO Metadata
description: Test CRUD operations on static pages with SEO metadata editing and verify accurate metadata rendering.

steps.description: Navigate to static pages module.
Create a new static page with content and SEO meta fields.
Verify page is listed and accessible.
View static page and check HTML metadata tags.
Verify SEO metadata is rendered correctly in the page source.
Edit and update static page metadata.
Verify changes are saved and reflected.
Delete static page.
Confirm page removal from system.

title: Gallery and Album Management with Drag-and-Drop Sorting
description: Verify adding, editing, deleting galleries and gallery items, and reordering photos/videos by drag-and-drop.

steps.description: Navigate to galleries management.
Create a new gallery album.
Verify album is saved and shown in the list.
Add photos/videos to the gallery.
Verify items appear within the gallery.
Reorder gallery items using drag-and-drop interface.
Verify the new order is persisted and reflected.
Delete gallery items and galleries.
Verify items and galleries are properly removed.

title: System Settings Persistence and Cache Invalidation
description: Verify that changes made in the system settings panel are saved, cached properly, and immediately affect application behavior.

steps.description: Navigate to system settings panel.
Update general, contact, and SEO settings.
Verify changes are saved successfully.
Verify that settings cache is refreshed or invalidated.
Visit relevant front-end pages to confirm updated settings impact (e.g., site name, SEO metadata).
Verify application behavior reflects new settings immediately.

title: User Engagement: Reactions API and Comment Moderation
description: Test asynchronous reaction API endpoints for updating counts and the comment moderation interface allowing approve, edit, and delete actions with immediate UI feedback.

steps.description: Perform a reaction (like/dislike/etc) via API endpoint.
Verify reaction count updates asynchronously in UI.
Log in as moderator and navigate to comment moderation panel.
Approve a pending comment.
Verify comment status updates and UI reflects approval instantly.
Edit a comment's content via moderation.
Verify edited content is saved and displayed correctly.
Delete a comment.
Confirm comment removal and UI update without page reload.

title: Activity Log Recording and Display
description: Verify activity logs capture all user actions such as login, content CRUD operations with accurate timestamps and user identification, and display correctly in the admin panel.

steps.description: Perform various user actions: login, create/edit/delete posts, categories, comments.
Navigate to activity log interface.
Verify logs list actions with correct user, timestamps, and descriptions.
Apply filters or search activity logs.
Verify filtering and search return accurate results.

title: Scheduled Publishing via CLI and Cron
description: Test that scheduled posts are published automatically at configured times when running the CLI command simulating cron job execution.

steps.description: Create posts with future publish dates.
Manually trigger the scheduled publishing CLI command simulating cron execution.
Verify posts scheduled for current time or earlier are published.
Verify posts scheduled for future time remain unpublished.
Repeat CLI command after advancing time to next scheduled post.
Verify the newly due posts are published appropriately.

title: Role-Based UI Access Restrictions
description: Verify that UI elements and modules are hidden or disabled according to user role permissions to restrict unauthorized access.

steps.description: Log in as a user with limited permissions.
Verify that navigation and UI components for unauthorized modules are not visible or accessible.
Attempt to access restricted module URL directly.
Verify access is denied with appropriate error or redirect.

title: Responsive UI Across Supported Browsers and Screen Sizes
description: Verify that the admin dashboard and all modules render and function correctly across supported desktop and mobile browsers and different screen resolutions.

steps.description: Open admin dashboard in major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) on desktop.
Verify layout, controls, and responsiveness function correctly.
Simulate various screen sizes including mobile widths.
Verify UI adapts properly without content overlap or cutoff.
